column4: I can't connect to wireless for some reason -- however it shows the wireless networks but the wireless networks that I want to connect to are grayed.
use Yelp
there is already a guide for resolving network issues
open a terminal, type yelp
Ill try to help you, what's the issue?
Well, its seeing the wifi networks but the wifi networks available is showing in grey.
have you tried disabling-re-enabling your adapter
Tried, still the same result.
is this new?
or did you just upgrade to natty
Its new.
install any new software? is this a new adapter?
Lastly I put quite a few updates on it.
open Synaptic file manager
Done.
go to file --> history
I am in there and now I see all the history.
Linux firmware thats about it.
hold on
can you try and find the package for your wireless card?
http://packages.ubuntu.com/
I managed to find the package and had to transfer it via usb to install it and it did but still no wifi.
not sure, never had an issue like this :/
It'll detect the wifi networks but the wifi networks come in greyed out.
